Exoplanet and Astrobiology¶

  • Just started

  • Help wanted: I am not very familiar with this topic, but it clearly has become one of the most important field in astronomy.

Transient Detection¶

  • exoplanet - Fast & scalable MCMC for all your exoplanet needs

    • exoplanet is a toolkit for probabilistic modeling of transit and/or radial velocity observations of exoplanets and other astronomical time series using PyMC3.

    • By Dan Foreman-Mackey.

  • pysyzygy - A fast and general planet transit (syzygy) code written in C and in Python

  • tls - An optimized transit-fitting algorithm to search for periodic transits of small planets

    • By Michael Hippke. Based on this paper

    • TLS searches for transit-like features with stellar limb-darkening and including the effects of planetary ingress and egress

  • planetplanet - A general photodynamical code for exoplanet light curves

    • By Rodrigo Luger. A general photodynamical code for modeling exoplanet transits, secondary eclipses, phase curves, and exomoons, as well as eclipsing binaries, circumbinary planets, and more

  • PyLDTk - Python Limb Darkening Toolkit

    • a Python toolkit for calculating stellar limb darkening profiles and model-specific coefficients for arbitrary passbands using the stellar spectrum model library by Husser et al (2013)

  • VESPA - Validation of Exoplanet Signals using a Probabilistic Algorithm

    • By Timothy Morton. It calculats false positive probabilities for transit signals

  • juliet - a versatile modelling tool for transiting and non-transiting exoplanetary systems

    • By Néstor Espinoza. Based on the paper Espinoza et al. 2018

  • exonailer - Tools for fitting transiting exoplanet lightcurves and radial velocities

    • By Néstor Espinoza. The EXOplanet traNsits and rAdIal veLocity fittER (EXO-NAILER), is an easy-to-use code that allows you to efficiently fit exoplanet transit lightcurves, radial velocities (RVs) or both.

  • batman - Bad-Ass Transit Model cAlculatioN

    • batman, a Python package for fast calculation of exoplanet transit light curves.

    • Based on the paper by Laura Kreidberg

Direct Imaging¶

  • PynPoint - Pipeline for processing and analysis of high-contrast imaging data

    • PynPoint is a generic, end-to-end pipeline for the data reduction and analysis of high-contrast imaging data of planetary and substellar companions, as well as circumstellar disks in scattered light.

    • Online document can be found here

  • orbitize - Orbit-fitting for directly imaged objects

Radial Velocity¶

  • wobble - precise data-driven RV fitting, now with tellurics

    • By Megan Bedell wobble is an open-source python package for analyzing time-series spectra. It was designed with stabilized extreme precision radial velocity (EPRV) spectrographs in mind, but is highly flexible and extensible to a variety of applications.

  • radvel - General Toolkit for Modeling Radial Velocity Data

    • Based on the publication by Fulton et al. 2018

Planet Atmosphere¶

  • PandExo - A Community Tool for Transiting Exoplanet Science with the JWST & HST

    • Tools to help the community with planning exoplanet observations

    • By Natasha Batalha

Taotie
